answers.answer: Hi,There are few possibilities which need to be looked into like migraines, TIA, eye strain due to poor eyesight, glaucoma, concussion, fungal meningitis, hypoglycemic attacks, and diabetes.I would suggest you to consult your GP about it as firm diagnosis can be made only after a through clinical evaluation.In the meantime make sure to eat on time, drink plenty of water and sleep for at least 8 hrs in the night. You can take OTC NSAIDS like motrin for headache.Hope this helps!

question: I wonder if anyone can help me out? I have never had headachs maybe a few times in my life but not very often. Now i am having them all the time and the are really bad sometimes. I also get blurred vision in my right eye and i am tiered all the time even if i get more than my 8 hrs a night. what could be wrong with me? any answers or comments would be great.
title: whats wrong
